tool.name: GEMINI @BINARY@
tool.description: Identify candidate violations of Mendelian inheritance
tool.command:
@PROVIDE_ANNO_DATA@
gemini @BINARY@
@COLUMN_SELECT@
@CMDLN_SQL_FILTER_FILTER_OPTION@
#if int($min_kindreds) > 0: --min-kindreds $min_kindreds #end if
#if str($families).strip(): --families "$families" #end if
$lenient $only_affected
-d $d
#if int($min_gq) > 0: --min-gq $min_gq #end if
#if int($gt_pl_max) > -1: --gt-pl-max $gt_pl_max #end if
"${ infile }" > "${ outfile }"

param.name: only_affected
param.label: Only consider candidates from affected samples.

tool.help:
**What it does**
Assuming you have defined the familial relationships between samples when loading your VCF into GEMINI, you can use this tool for identifying mutations that violate the Mendelian inheritance scheme.
